grounding: Tensor networks provide extremely powerful tools for the study of complex classical and quantum many-body problems. Over the past two decades, the increment in the number of techniques and applications has been relentless, and especially the last ten years have seen an explosion of new ideas and results that may be overwhelming for the newcomer. This short review introduces the basic ideas, the best established methods, and some of the most significant algorithmic developments that are expanding the boundaries of the tensor network potential. The goal of this review is to help the reader not only appreciate the many possibilities offered by tensor networks but also find their way through state-of-the-art codes, their applicability, and some avenues of ongoing progress.
generated_text: Tensor Network Algorithms have emerged as a powerful tool in computational physics, offering a novel approach to the numerical simulation of quantum many-body systems. By leveraging the principles of quantum information and entanglement, these algorithms provide an efficient framework for understanding complex quantum phenomena. This paper presents a comprehensive route map of Tensor Network Algorithms, detailing their development, theoretical underpinnings, and practical applications. We explore their role in advancing our understanding of quantum systems, highlighting their ability to tackle problems that are intractable with traditional methods. Through a series of case studies, we demonstrate the versatility and effectiveness of Tensor Network Algorithms in various domains of physics, underscoring their potential to revolutionize the field of numerical simulations in quantum physics.
